lead_paragraph: The evacuation breakdown came a day after more than 8,000 people from eastern Aleppo had been taken out. Many thousands are said to remain.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Malachy Browne from New York, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, Nick Bruce from Geneva and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, HWAIDA SAAD and BEN HUBBARD

headline.print_headline: Thousands of Residents Still Trapped in Aleppo as Evacuations Break Down
headline.main: Aleppo Evacuation Halted Amid Confusion and Concerns About Killings

snippet: The evacuation breakdown came a day after more than 8,000 people from eastern Aleppo had been taken out. Many thousands are said to remain....
abstract: Evacuation of residents from last rebel-held area of Aleppo, Syria, breaks down when Russia claims, incorrectly, that all civilians wanting to leave have been evacuated; thousands remain trapped in city; breakdown is blamed on hard-line forces on both sides.
